text:
Finlandia Strong Sahti
Sahti/Gotlandsdricke/Koduõlu
547412

Lukt: Malt, frukter, svakt bål, bråte, sild.
Utseende: Rødbrun.
Skum/kullsyre: Ikke skum eller karbonering.
Smak: Mild, malt, krydder, frukter, svakt bål, einer.
Hvor: Lokal tasting på Bryne.
Medium: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */%, Nå[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

12.06.2017, 0,75l bottle @ home:
No head, just some bubbles. Aroma is sweet mineraly, very overripe banana, grass, yeast, minerals, fruit stones, overripe cantaloupe melon, shed, alcohol, hints of smoke. Taste is sweet mineraly, sap, very overripe banana, yeast, minerals, fruit stones, grass, sugar, alcohol, raisins, overripe cantaloupe melon, burnt toast. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh and sweet mineraly mouthfeel. Fair enough.

Pours with little to no foam. Color is cloudy mead or homemade beer. Aroma is fruity and sweet and has malts, fireplace, banana, strawberry/raspberry, blueberry, cinnamon, coriander and plenty of other aromas. Therefore the aroma is definitely complex. Palate is more oily than dry. Theres very little, almost no carbonation. Taste is "fermented" having dried plums, moist raisins, overripe banana and other overripe flavours, some yeast. Theres slightly too much alcohol taste to my taste so the normal (rather than Strong) version might be better. The taste may require some accustomation, but this can be an enjoyable drink, especially for winter months, when enjoyed in small amounts.
Makea, samea, hiivainen ja hedelmäinen. Mukava tuttavuus, mutta enpä tätä tuopillista kiskois.
[2015 Backlog] Sampled at Pauls place. Pours a hazy amber body with soft carbonated lacing. Mouthfeel is light to medium bodied with notes of sugar, soft vague fruit, spice, banana and malty bread.
Kuparinruskea väri, ei lainkaan vaahtoa. Hajussa hiivaisuutta, mutta vähemmän kuin Pihamaan Talvessa. Maku makeahko, mutta ei niin makea kuin Pihamaan Talvessa.
Sample from a plastic bottle. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, spice, alochol, malt and fruit.

Plastic bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty vegetable aroma. Fruity malty weak sour spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty sour tart finish.
Very similar to the lighter version. The alcohol is just slightly more noticeable and the juniper just slightly more intense. A strange brew, that Im certain must vary widely between breweries.

Its in the 1001 beers to try before you die, and Im in Tampere, Finland. So why not indulge. 

Bananas! On the nose and on the palate.

I was informed by my host to drink it very chilled. Admits not bad. Not good though. You feel the strength hit you, but it doesnt taste strong. Perfectly drinkable! Although its 75cl and 10% might stop you having too many that nigh.

A big "Mahalo" to Rosenbergh (Jan) for dragging this and another dozen or so beers all the way from Finland to Hawaii! Very similar in appearance and aroma to the 8% version. Sweet, bananas and caramel with bubblegum and light alcohol .A hazy caramel colored beer. Very sweet & fruity. Very little carbonation. Not sure if its the extra 2% that gives this an extra kick, but I prefer this, stronger Sahti.

Plastic bottle shared to commemorate the finale of Jacks visit to London. Thanks to Paul for this fine offering. Pours hazy golden-brown. The nose holds doughy wheat, orange and ripe, bruised up banana. Medium to heavy sweet flavor, syrupy, with more old banana, wheat dough. Full bodied, soft, oily and chewy. Viscous. Warming on the finish with chewy, ripe fruits, banana, bread. OK stuff.

Bottle split at Jack The Sipper leaves for the FBI again tasting, thanks to Scopey, 14/07/15.
Murky orange amber with a decent beige covering.
Nose is earthy fruit, light fart, spice, rhubarb, straw.
Taste is a little harsh, rich dark fruit, juniper, spice, bitter edge.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with sweetnsour lickings.
Ok but preferred the lower ABV version.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 14th July 2015Farewell Jack bottleshare at Craft Clerkenwell. Thanks to Paul for this unusual beer. Hazy reddish amber with no head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, no carbonation. Bubblegum. Tangy fruits. Cranberry. Little spice. Light finish. Holds together quite well and is certainly tasty.

Plastic bottle @ Clerkenwell Share. Thanks, Paulo. Hazy deep amber pour with a small bubbly white head. Really strong musty fermented apple aroma. Quite sweet and fruity. Berry mash and notes of allspice and cinnamon. The flavor is tangy and a touch acidic. Caramel-steeped grain. Musty peach skin. Pretty thick and chewy. Strange, but not unappealing.

Bottle share at CBC Clerkenwell. Many thanks to Paul for another sahti. Clear plastic bottle, BB Aug 2015, 10.1%. Cloudy dirty orange, no head at all, still. Aroma is apple, earthy, plastic, alcohol. Body is medium, light carbonation, smooth. Taste is honey, earthy, resinous, solvent. More solvent in the flavour than in their normal sahti. Preferred the other version.

14th July tasting at CBC EC1. Big up the man like Scopey on this one, my first ever Sahti tick. Looks a bit like a glass of Berocca, loads of sediment. Aroma is very sweet with orange, citrus, maybe a bit of banana. Taste is fruity with a bit of spice. Very oily mouthfeel with not much carbonation. Booze is very well hidden. Enjoyed this one.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared at craft beer co JackL leaving drinks. Thanks to paul. Hazed golden reddy coloured pour with no head. Aroma is sweet honey, berry, unrefined sugars. Tangy orange. Flavour is tangy orange, bitter orange. Honey Berry. Palate is chewy, thick, oily, lowish carbonation. A quite like it.

Bottle shared at Craft Beer. It pours cloudy deep orange with a decent yellowish head. The nose is sweet, oily, bakewell tart, marzipan, earthy, herbal, barnyard, dirt and dried fruits. The taste is sweet-sour, rich dried fruits, cranberry, mild acidity, stewed orange, light alcohol, spicy, herbal, some boost, sherbet, apricot and banana bread with a fruity finish. Medium+ body and fine carbonation. A bit chewy perhaps. Very fruity. Decent sahti.

750 ml plastic bottle. BB 27/07/2015. (Alko) Tampere, Finland.
Hazy dark reddish copper color with a tiny frothy rainbow-colored ring. 
Very strong sugary sweetness, banana sweetness, sahti maltiness and some juniper and spicy notes in the aroma. Rich sahti aroma. 
The flavour is sweetness, sugar, banana, sahti malt, alcohol, some bitterness and juniper. No carbonation. A bit less alcohol and thats it.
Bottle. Frothy White mostly deminishing head. Amber colour. Light hoppy and moderate malty aroma. Strong moderate bitter and light swet flavor. Long powerfull malty alcoholic finish. Oily palate.
Amber coloured and hazy. Has almost no head. Heavy sweet and fatty aroma, toasted notes. Heavy sweet flavor, notes of banana, yeasty. Syrupy texture.
light fresh sweet malty aroma,brown, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long nice harmonic finish.

Bottle @ fonefan tasting. Hazy brown without head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, yeasty and banana. Flavor is very sweet. Sweet finish. Nice and fresh. Thanks to Patrik and Antti for bringing this. 200615
Plastic bottle @ fonefan tasting. No head. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are yeast, banana, wheat malt, fruits and herbs. Nice and odd.

500ml bottle shared by ippopotamo36 (thanks Alberto!). Unclear orange apprarance with no head. Aroma is apricot juice, rotten pumpkin, vomit, terrible! Flavour is very sweet, fruity, with a terrific vomit aftertaste. Some alcohol traces. Medium body, low carbonation. What a terrible experience!

[ PET Bottle ][ 500mL+ ][ rosenbergh ][ Trade ][ Globe ][ 5.2.15 ]
>> Hazy amber pour, flatter/low carbonation. Dunkelweizen nose like the regular Sahti, some vanilla frosting. Taste is brown sugar, no alcohol even at 10%, no acid like the regular version, no juniper, no bitterness, strange overall. Prefer the non "Strong" version.

Many thanks to Hermod for my first Sahti from Finland! Tübe dunkel oranggoldene Farbe, keine Schaumbildung. Geruch hefig, sehr reife Bananen, überreifes Obst. Geschmack sehr süß hefig, bananig, Kräuter, leicht alkoholisch.

Wow. The aroma is bringing me all back to De manke monnik in Amsterdam or is it Vana tallinn-version of beer.... Good fun. However, he red unclear body has a correspondig questionable flavour... not a favourite. Strong and sweet, ad expected from a sahti.. But off course, it is named finlandia. This is for crazy sauna party.
Bottle. Slightly unclear amber body. No head. Heavy yeasty aroma, candy, bubble gum. Flavour is yeast, berries, very sweet. Low carbonation. Heavy sweet finish, too heavy. (At home, 19.04.2015)

Appearance: PET bottle. Blood orange, murky, not much head. Some white sediments at the bottom of the bottle.
Aroma: Fruit, forest, slight tartness?
Taste: Ripe fruit, juniper, forest. Hides the alcohol very well. Shit, man, I am actually starting to enjoy Sahti beers.
Bought: Trade with rosenbergh - thank you very much!, 750 ml
Info: 21/3-2015, BB: 7/4-2015

Bottle at Pauls for Andy and Maxs Fantasy Football winnings tasting. Pours a clear amber with a thin white head. Soft herbal notes, vanilla and warming toast, juniper. Medium bodied, syrupy, warming smoke, juniper, banana. Long banana, sweet herbal notes, a hint of smoke.

Fra flaske (0,75 PET med skrukork, bb. 090215) på RBHD-treff hos OG mars-15: iflg etiketten framstilt av "vatten, kornmalt, bagarjäst, humle och en". Lett uklar oransjegylden fullstendig uten skum. Lukter røykamakrell og tannlegekontor. Smaker som surnet hjemmelaget saft.

Shared 750 ml clear plastic screwcap bottle. Hazy golden-brown colour, no carbonation. Strong aroma of band-aid (gammeldags norgesplaster av den vevde typen), dentist surgery and alcohol, hints of rotting bananas. Sweet flavour, fruity and honey notes. Best drunk as part of social anthropology studies in the Finnish countryside.
Shared bottle at RB/HD at OGJs 03.03.15. Hazy, dark orange. No head. Aroma of weiss-bier-banana and smoked malt. Similar taste, with sour fruits. Probably an aquired taste.

Shared0,75 l plastic bottle at RBHD gathering, March 2015. Muddy orange body with no head. Pleasant pungient smokey,yeasty over-ripe bananana. Acidic. fruity with all the aromas present. Full bodied. Flat and syrupy.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours hazy deep orange with no head at all. Aroma is weak malty with a slightly smoked note. Taste is strange fruity, medicinal and berryish, half rotten bananas, strange,

Bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks!). Pours brown with beige head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, smoke, junipers. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, wheat, some fruits. Some alcohol is noticeable, but its not distracting. Overall: very nice and interesting brew.
Plastic bottle from Janne. Pours muddy brown. Nose/taste of banana peel, bubblegum, tree bark, juniper, herbal and floral notes. Medium body. Alcohol in finish.

Bottle from VastActiv for season premiere of vikings. Murky amber brew. Nose of banana and forest. Tastes of banana, toffee, herbal, spruce, bubblegum, and alcohol. No carbonation really. Sweet and boozy finish.

January 24, 2015. Bottle. Shared by tderoeck, thanks Tim! Hazy amber with no head. a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet caramel, ripe banana, peach, some cinnamon and light clove notes. Taste is sweet caramel and peach, light spicy, some astringency, warming alcohol in the finish. Medium bodied, flat.

Dark amber, small head. Candy, lots of sweetness, fruit, banana, warming booze hints. Finishes with booze notes, mild hop bitterness. Lingering fruit and caramel. Almost flat carbonation. Nicely balanced.

My first sahti, many thanks to tderoeck for sharing this. Forms no head, just some loose, quickly disappearing air bubbles; hazy bronze colour. Meaty and sweaty aroma, sweet, caramel, pine needle, overripe apple, medlar fruit, thyme, juniper berries, tea, rhum-like alcohol. Sweet caramelly and estery taste, overripe stonefruit, brown sugar, banana, lactic acid touch with somewhat refreshing effect; soft and mellow malt sweetness, yeastiness, sourishness increasing and drying in the finish, some cloying sweetness as well but very low bitterness. Very fascinating and in fact very enjoyable as well if you like big, sweet beers. I will have to taste other sahtis, however, in order to be fully able to rate this...

Thanks to tderoeck. 750 ml. clear plastic bottle sampled @ Tim needs to get rid of his ticks Tasting. Enjoyed together with tderoeck, Benzai & Alengrin. Looking back at my notes, I liked the regular version quite a bit more but I did have that one a lot fresher than this one so that might be a big factor. Pours hazy to murky brown, flat liquid. Nose is quite pleasant, sweet syrup, caramel, cinnamon, thick malt. Taste is cheap candy, butter scotch, toffee, caramel, sugar leading into a weird bad teabag, fizzy, fermenting raisins etc. Finish takes it down for me. Quite malt & sugar thick body with obv. No carbonation. Interesting for sure, it may be far from easy to do a whole bottle of this for me but I do suppose that it is just a matter of getting used to it.
Sampled from bottle @ Tim needs to get rid of his ticks tasting. Hazy dark orange color, virtually no head. Smell and taste malts, a bit sweet, sourish, hard to describe. Decent body and carbonation.

28/XI/14 - 75cl plastic bottle @ home - BB: 10/XII/14 (2014-1437) Thanks to Ercan for the bottle!
Clear reddish brown beer, small irregular bit bubbled head, dissipates quickly, non adhesive. Aroma: sweet, caramel, lots of banana, bit chemical. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: very sweet, sugary, lots of banana, caramel, bit yeasty. Aftertaste: sweet and sugary, alcohol, bit yeasty, spicy.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2015 Bottle 0.75l at tderoeck place. Thank you Tim & Marina for wonderful dinner and great time.Pour it amber color with small white head.No carbonation at all.Taste and aroma of banana, honey, strawberry, malt and little bit apple.All together interesting style.Worth to try it

750ml plastic bottle. Hazy orange/brown. Just a small ring of head. Aroma to me smells "foresty" (thatll be the juniper) with notes of glue and banana yeastiness. Taste is similar, but feels a bit more complex, mainly I think from the rye grain influence. Drinks a bit easier than 10%. Odd but strangely compelling; about what I expected.

Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Pours like fruit salad juice with no head, aroma of Juniper, fruits, plums, clove and peach, flavor of plums, peach, Juniper, cider, peach, medium bodied.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2014 750 ml bottle
Clear mahogany beer with no head. Aroma has glueish yogurt and fruit candyish banana. Flavor is slightly tart and fruity sweet with strawberry and banana. Full and soft palate. Long finish with banana and alcohol. Compared to the normal version, this has more alcohol and more glue.

Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at our place. Thanks Stas for arranging, thanks Mia for delivering and thanks DSG for remembering and saving us some! Headless cloudy brown. Pungent fruit syrup and spices, then some phenol in the nose. Estery, sweet, a little honey taste. No carbonation whatsoever, light-to-medium body, a little smoky aftertaste. 10% abv. are not apparent at all. Sampled on Friday, bottle opened on Wednesday but apparently remained fine.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks Stas. Hazy red-amber without any head. Fruity and spicy aroma. Sweet with caramel, fruity and spicy notes, alcohol is dangerously well hidden. Medium-full bodied, low carbonation. Interesting.

Plastic bottle sample at a tasting at Stass place. Thanks Stas. Cloudy orange-amber with no head. Aroma of yeast, fruit esters, a bit of caramel and a bit of bubblegum. Sweet flavor full of fruit esters, bubblegum, a bit of spices (some juniper), caramel and a bit of honey. Medium-bodied, no carbonation, kinda slick. Mouthfeel is a bit liqueur-like or mead-like, but alcohol is extremely well-hidden. Good and interesting.

Note: originally rated 3.4. Tried another sample from the same bottle 2 days later and gave another point for palate.

Bottle, many thanks rosenbergh, highly cloudy brown to deep orange colour, almost no head, aroma of fruit, vanila wood and spicewith some vinegar in the back, fruity flavourwith some funk and a touch of caramel and sour bread, pleasant quitev strong sourness, suprisingly light considering the abv. Very good.
Im totally new to Sahti. Anyway I enjoyed this one, balanced and interesting.

(Poured from plasti jug at St. Urhos Pub XIX sahtipäivät, 2014) The beer poured dark brown and hazy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had juniper, sweetness and malts. Palate was medium bodied and warming with low carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, malts, juniper, alcohol and low bitterness. Aftertaste had sweetness, booze and juniper. A boozy but otherwise balanced sahti.

750ml PET bottle generously shared by dnicolaescu. 
Cloudy orange-brown body, minimal white head. Aroma of ammonia, yeast, glue, pine, heavy and unpleasant. Soft and rounded mouthfeel: strongly boozy, sugar, yeast, grains, fermented bread, some berries. Heavy, exotic and unusual.

PET 75CL from rosenbergh. Thanks, Jan!

Look: very cloudy amber-red with a humble off-white head.
Aroma: lots of esters, fruits, acetone, green apple astringency, a bit catty.
Taste: juicy, fruity, the sweetness is balanced by some nice acidity, green apple bitterness/astringency.
Quite unique and very rough, with a young and unwieldy homemade character. Pretty much the same as the regular version.

75cl bottle thanks to rosenbergh. Cheers Jan! Color is dark red/brown. Head is almost non-existing. Body is thin but oily. Taste is medium bitter, sour, a bit salty. Aroma is smoke, rye, cereals all around, alcohol, caramel, malt, remedy, bread, spices. Quite an experience, again!

Thanks to erzengel for sharing!! Pours a hazy brown with orange highlights and a nice tight tan head - though small. The smell is dark rye bread, fruit, spice, caramel. The taste is spicy rye, tangy fruit, caramel, some alcohol heat, fruit ending dry and spicy. The beer is medium in body with nice tight carbonation. The nicest sahti that I have tried so far.

Thanks to Rosenbergh for this great stuff!  The nose is very fruity and yeasty. Caramel-sweet. Some herbs. The brew starts smooth, but not as great as the lower % version. Some juniper-notes in the mainpart, smooth caramel, yeast. Nice malt. The aftertaste is long, smooth. The bakers-yeast (!) creates an aroma of fresh yeast-dough together with the brown smooth caramel-malt. The juniper fits in great, but could be a bit more intense.  --> Great stuff. but the lower %-version is a bit deeper in aroma, probably due to the huge sweetness of this brew. It is probably even a bit too sweet. --> 12/13/11/12

Bottle @ home. schiuma beige grossolana, scarsa, poco persistente. Birra marrone con riflessi ramati, opalescente. Profumo intenso acetico, fruttato /frutti rossi/ vinoso/ alcolico. Gusto intenso, persistente. Ingresso dolce amabile, poi vira decisamente sullacido. Astringente, asciuga la bocca. citrica, un sacco di frutti rossi , ha anche un dolce che si situa a metà tra miele e melassa. Finale improvviso, retrolfattivo che ricorda le fermentazioni miste delle fiandre.

Plastic Bottle. Pours dark orange, almost brown, without head. Sweet juniper aroma with strong notes of balkong yeast. Tastes somewhat like a barely wine. Its strong, vinous, and bittersweet. Notes of juniper, marzipan, chocolate and baking yeast. Almost zero carbonation.

Bottle thanks Benji and Sev. Ambwr with off white head. Aroma of funk, spice, oak , wood pepper. Taste is eaerhty, spicy, woody spme funky stuff going on. Little sweet and little tangy with some alcohol. Quite nice and complex
Finland Sahti. strong.10% købt helsinki finland. Duft Gran, let røget, krydret, sødme ful duft, Smag: stor smag af honning, meget sød i smagen, honning, blomster, karamel, kanel

.2l @ Vihreä Haltiatar
Pours hazy dark orange with no head. Aroma is dark fruits, sweet banana, malts, tooth fluor. Flavor is alcohol, yeast, banana and dark fruits. Bready palate.
Draft. Orange hazy pour with white head. Some berry and wheat like notes. Has a touch of dark fruit and sweetness.

Bottle, 0.5. Brown murky with good yeast dregs if you let it sit. The quality of this product varies a lot, depending not only on the batch quality, as it is exceptionally sensitive to at what point you drink it and how its been handled. The one Im having is really pea/asparagus- tainted, yeasty with some phenolic/bad alcohol vibes. Under that a really musty ripe banana, sweet malts, juniper. Its hard to rate something this volatile, but this is what I feel about this one. Ill probably average it out when I get a better sample to try.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2013 sample from a jug at St Urhos Pub, Helsinki.  Faintly hazed amber, still body. Acetone and banana nose with sharp alcohols that make it seem closer to 15-17% than 10%.  Boozy browned banana liqueur and paint thinner / rubbing alcohol.  Raw and wort-y. Flat, lightly acidic, sweet, low bitterness.  Lingering alcohol burn in the finish.  Unpalatable.
0,75l bottle. Small white head. Flavor is malts, sweet juniper/berry. Very nicely hidden alcohol and minimal carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Pours hazy brown with no head at all. The aroma is pretty unique among beers; it is full of overripe banana, spicy notes of juniper and sweet maltiness. Taste is heavily sweet with the flavours of banana, juniper and fudge appearing. Sweetness lingers until finish; no hoppy bitterness at all. The palate is medium to full bodied, low in carbonation and sticky. Alcohol warms but doesnt appear in the taste which makes this deceptively easy to drink. Sahti isnt the most complex of beers but definitely one of the most interesting  the antithesis of commercial bulk beers. This stronger version of Finlandia Sahti is the one I prefer.

Bottle from Alko HyvinkÃ¤Ã¤. (order selection, normally fridge is just full of sparklings). Dark brown. Sweet chocolate aroma. Sweet banana candy taste with chocolate and little alcohol bite. Tasty but Not easy to drink because sweetness and fullness.---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle, many thanks to rosenbergh. Hazy red orange color with medium white head. Malt, wheat, banana in aroma. Taste, wheat, yeast, junipers, banana esters, light bitterness in finish. Alcohol is dangerously hidden. Good.

Kaatuu lasiin ruskeanoranssina ja täysin vaahdottomana. Haju on käyneen hedelmäinen (sekä tuoretta että kuivattua), katajainen ja makea. Maku on täyteläisen makean hedelmäinen (banaania, mangoa, kuivattua hedelmää), kuten myös katajaa. Myös tuore kananmuna tuli itselle mieleen. Suutuntuma on täyteläinen, lopussa tuntui alkoholin polttavuus. Kokonaisuutena hieno ja täyteläisen makuinen suomalainen oman alansa huipputuote.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2013 
75 cl bottle @ Nurmo. Rated on 25.06.2010
Aroma is rather sweet with banana esthers, yeasty notes, toffee and alcohol. Flavour is sweet with banana, toffee, some warming and slightly stinging alcohol and yeasty notes. A solid sahti, better than the 8% version as the alcohol cuts the sweetness nicely.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2015 750ml bottle (shared by FatPhil, thanks). Muddy brown color with some redish hue. Banana, bready, yeasty, bit sour and alcohol in aroma. Sweet, mildly bitter, yeast, alcohol in flavor. Alcohol is way too up in front and kind of shades all other fine flavors.
Re-rate: No sign of alcohol in this one. Caramel and bready notes and hazelnuts in aroma and taste. Points go up!

75 cl plastic bottle flown in from the motherland (fatherland?), courtesy of Greg at ChurchKey, thank you sir!  Murky brown color, flat.  Aroma of sour orange peel, spice, Christmas trees.  Taste is sour and spiced summer fruit.  Interesting but tough stuff!

0,5 l on tap @ Vihreä Haltiatar. Pours clear deep amber with a very low  head. Aroma is malts and banana. Flavor is malts, too sweet banana and too much alcohol. Not a very good Sahti in my opinion but quite drinkable.

75cl plastic bottle, shared by Greg at ChurchKey.  No head atop murky dark amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, juniper, bread, some candi sugar, yeast/funk.  Taste is sweet, juniper/berry, some alcohol, vanilla, orange.  Sticky full body, minimal carbonation.
Glass from Gallows Bird, Espoo. Colour is hazy brown with small white head. Aroma and flavours are sweetness, malta, banana and toffee. Quite like "weizenbock"

75 cl bottle.
Pours slightly hazy dark orange color with a minimal head. Aroma of ripe fruits, juniper, some spicy and herbal notes, malts and some sugar. Flavor of ripe fruits, caramel, some toffee, herbs, spice notes and mild warming alcohol at the end. Sweetish fruity palate with a bit tart finish. Very nice warming brew for cold autumn nights.
5435
ark amber color, smokey, juniper berries, caramel, fig. Sweet, smokey, lots of bubblegum and caramel. Very sweet. Pineneedles, alcohol well hidden. Lingerig smokey finish.
Bottle, courtesy of Baggio. Cloudy amber-brown with lace. Fruity nose, light smoke, caramel, berries, juniper. Very sweet, nice fruit, berries, light smoke, caramel. Cloying as hell but interesting.
Lovely smokey sweet berry nose. Smooth, super sweet body. Lots of sweet berries, some wood - but soooo cloying. Smooth body hides the alcohol well.
Strong banana flavour and aroma. Finnish baking yeast is strongly present in aroma and flavour. No head and no carbonation. Brown colour. Sahti menee päähän hyvin!
Pours hazy brown with no heaad. No carbonation as it should be. Aroma banana, sour fruit. Sweet bread yeast taste. Great stuff. Not Bad.

Strong smell of bananas. Hazy mid-brown colour with no head whatsoever. Aroma of citrus and banana, maybe some peach afterwards. Oily and alcohol content adds sharpness & sweetness. Very sweet. Some juniper sourness to be noticed when a little warmer.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Rerate, 4.11.2015: BB 07.12.2015. 75 cl, bottled (plastic). Pours cloudy rust with no head. Aroma: Earth, wood, yeast, dust. Fruity esters. Nutty tones. Mild alcohol tones, not bothering. Taste: Sweet, banana, fruity notes. Juniper. Some licorice in flavour. Nuts. Notably yeast. Palate: Medium body, minimal carbonation, slippery, slightly oily feel. Good. Some mild bitterness in aftertaste and licorice notes. Very pleasant sahti overall.  
-----
75 cl, bottled (plastic). Pours cloudy rust, no head. Aroma: Earth, wood, juniper, yeast, root cellar, smoke. Taste: Sweetish, banana flavours, berries, yeast. Some bitterness. Palate: Light, soft and oily. Nice. (18.8.2011, 8-3-8-4-14)

Cloudy, copperbrown beer withou any head. Aroma is strong, bananas, some spicys, carnations, and some strenght from alcohol. Taste is sweet, bananas, some spicys and juniper, you can feel to power of alcohol but without taste of alcohol. Almost full bodied, slippery and very smooth to drink. Very pleasant and tastefull beer (overally Sahti has quite similar aroma and taste profile than weizenbocks have), kindly strong and powerfull, but still easy to enjoy.

Bananiger Geruch. Fruchtig würziger und sehr süßer Antrunk, deutlich zu süß. Etwas alkohlisch ist das Bier dabei auch, es erscheint unausgweogen. Der Nachgeschmack ist lang, süß und mittelfruchtig. 	 
Test vom 30.5.2007, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: -,9,9,11,8,10 - 9,72

dark amber colour. sediment in the bottom of the bottle told me to pour it carefully after it had had time to sit still for a couple of days. The beer is still too hazy to see through. no bubbles (that i can see) and no head.
smells great! lots of alcohol and bananas. maybe some coriander as well. a lot like a wheat beer.
full body, initially flat but a little bit of fizz near the back end. kind of heavy and sugary.
very interesting. Tastes a bit like you would imagine a 10% hefe would taste. lots of alcohol, some rich raisin flavour goes with that, but still the banana and coriander are prominent. has a slightly nettle-y finish but not from hops. must be from the filtration through nettles and hay, if they do that. otherwise, possibly they simply added brush in the boil. 
a fun beer.

750 ml bottle. BBE 11.4.2011.
Pours a beautiful dark amber colour without a head. Aroma of strong banana with some clove. Flavour of clove, sweet banana, some lemon and bready malts. Medium bodied with a slick mouthfeel and no carbonation. Warming finish. Pretty much the same as Finlandia Sahti with more alcohol bite of course.

About 200ml from a 750ml plastic bottle, bought at Alko Arkadia. Slightly cloudy, amber coloured body. Missing head, just a few bubbles. Mild aroma of sweet malts and sweet, dried fruits. Sweet ripe fruits, including a banana touch, in flavour. Dry ending. Noticeable alcohol. Very much on the sweet side, but alright in a smaller amount. The rest of the bottle was placed in the minibar and used for sipping during the next few days at my hotel room in Helsinki, 03.02.2011.

Plastic bottle (trade with Jukkabro - thanks).  Very sweet banana malt aroma with a hint of juniper.  Murky orange-brown color with no head.  Sweet ripe banana malt and moderately bitter juniper flavor.  Full body - the alcohol is well hidden.   Seemed to be more balanced than the regular.  Very nice - would love to have this regularly  but doubt I will ever get to try another true sahti.  Huge thanks to Janne for giving me the chance to experience this.
Bottle 75 cl. Poured brown in colour with no head. Aroma is sweet fruity and juniper. Flavour is sweet banana-like and hints of juniper.

Shared bottle. Poured red/brown color with no head. Aroma is banana and yeast mostly. Flavor is sweet with fruits and yeast and some alcohol also detectable. Very thick and smooth mouthfeel. Liked this better than the other version. Very drinkable despite the high ABV. Maybe not a favourite of mine, but could enjoy a glass every now and then of this.

First Sahti rating courtesy of nisse666. I grew up with this stuff back in Ypäjä, Finland. Not as good as the farmers do back home but drinkable. Pours hazy orange brown, no head due no carbonation, some sedimant in the pour. Aroma is fruity with bananas, citrus fruits, also nutty and bready tones. Velvety lean - as Sahti should be - thick mouthfeel. Alcohol (10%) noticeable in flavor with apricots, oats and sweetnes. in sweet fruity palate. Finishes slightly sweet sour.

Plastic bottle from Alko Mariehamn, BB 13.09.2010, cons 2010-11-27 Sätila. Possitive in that the BB had past didnt effect the rating!
AR: sour, banana foam, belgian yeast, flour
AP: hazy amber, a bit thick floating, no head
F: banana, dry yeast, heavy alcohol, old banana in the finish + flour

22/05 0.75 l bottle that Doggythedog brought from Helsinki, thanks. Before trying it, I was sure I wont put my rating here, as it spent too much time opened, but nevertheless, I got the idea of the style and this particular beer very well. So, it poured murky brown body with tiny head. Quite fine aroma, malty in caramel and fruity way, with strange wheat estery, yeasty way (banana, orange, juniper berries) Sweet, slightly acidic and already very cloying. Flavor is fine, obviously unpasteurized, sourish, with caramel and bread malt dominating along with tart yeast components. Very thick in body, you can actually chew it. Long, sourish yeasty finish. As I said, it was a bit too old, but obviously remained its major characteristics. Nice beer experience.

plastic bottle 750ml. -Courtesy of Doggythedog who brought it from Finland (thanks!). Murky dark orange coloured, minimal white head, acidic fruity nose. Acidic fruity, spicy and slight wheaty with notes of juniper and alcohol. Quite acidic finish; obvious this one spent too much time in opened plastic bottle (more than a weak). Until fresh one...

Bottle from some Alko near Kamppi. Almost no head, murky ruby red body. Banana dominates the otherwise malty nose.Of course, its again in the taste, which is really soft and smooth, other than the gingery burn you get. Sugary. Some alcohol too. Quite nice!

Thanks Fatphil for the tip and to take me to the Beer shop. A cloudy amber color with no head. Aroma is complex, fruity with notes of banana, pears, cinamon, yeasty and Alcohol. Flavor is quite spicy and fruity, some alcohol. After taste is kind sweety and dry. Good one but too much in a Plastic Bottle. 75cl.
Muddy orange with no head. Aroma dominated by yeast, with fruit and some clove. Sweet and yeasty flavour with some alcohol.

plastic bottle, thank you Patrik! Bright juicy strawberry red. Totally flat looking. Sour, sangria aroma of alcohol, saturated bananas, plums, and peaches all drenched in wine. Thick viscous palate is a little oily. Sweet flavors with lots of wine-soaked banana, juicy oranges, and slices of other fruit. Strong, wacky beverage. Lots of fun but personally I preferred the regular.

Coarse white head. Hazy amber body. Fruity banana alcohol and sugar aroma with notes of juniper and peas. Sweet-musty earthy fruity peas taste with alcoholic bubblegum notes. Some alcohol heat. Soft, smooth mouthfeel. Full boduy. Sweetish spicy juniper vegetable aftertaste. I really dont like it, but am hard pressed to say why. (Bottle shared by a nameless fellow beer geek.)

Thanks to Patrick. Amber oranagey colour with no head. Loads of fruity esthers, pear drops, yeast caramel and malt. Tastes very like a wheat beer on background with hints of clove. I really like sahti i know its not every1’s cup of tea but ive been hooked since wknd spontanious fermentation with patrick . Patrick u r a legend.
Hazy orange colour with no head. Aroma is sweet banana. The flavour is sweet, yeast and banana with some spices also hints of alcohol. Smooth and medium-bodied. Very nice Sahti.

Bottled, thanks to my Sathi-dealer; Baggio. Cloudy orange brown with no head. Loads of phenolic fruits in the aroma of banana, pears and figs with notes of yeast, cinnamon and alcohol. Full-bodied and quite warming of cloves, banana, fruitcakeand alcohol. Long yeasty and warming finish of cloves and bananas. Ear-warming and more intruding than it’s little brother.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */

Apperance is rubyred with almost no head and low carbonation. Smells of cloves, banana and some citric notes. Taste is very sweet with hints of bread, malt, caramel, yeast. This is a beer to sip on but quite a good one at that. Might be a bit too sweet.

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 Bottle at Chris oshazy pink orange, banana wheat,sweet loads of cloves some banana...  bottle home ..hazy copper ... thin white head ... soft zezty fruit ... banana wheat ... light smoke but not woody smoke ... zezty ligth tart berriers ...definite alcohol... stick at 3.7

Close to no head, hazy orange slightly reddish color. Basic Sahti-aroma: yeast and bananas with some nice earthiness. Very strong flavor, a bit alcoholic. Thick palate. Pretty good but not as good as the 8% little brother.
Chris_os GBBF Shindig 08. Plastic bottle. Very sweet and fruity. Quite crude and strong like a strong kvass. Quite bready and malty. Interesting.

A Mes rate: Bottle at Chris Os Pre GBBF TastingBright orange with a thin white head. Very sweet aroma with some slight smoke and citrus. Sugary as hell in the mouth. Rather adorable really. Love the herbacious notes. It’s madness. I like it. Never going to be a big scorer but was great fun to drink. Abv is there but it’s just shouting "come ooooon drink meeeeee":)

Had this at Chris Os pre GBBF tasting, 02-08-08 cheers for a wonderful day Chris   Pours light amber looked like one of my grandads dodgy homebrews. very alcoholic, sweet warming alcohol swirls around the mouth quite rough but not unlikeable rough edge to this, unusual bu ok.

Bottle at Chris_o Pre GBBF Shindig 08.  Thanks to Patrik for this.  After the shock of my first sahti, I approached this with much trepidation.  Fortunately, this was much better.  Hazy red/orange colour with still some banana on the aroma.  Like a wheat beer.  Interesting, but still not great.

Thanks to jjpm74 for sharing 100% of this breweries beers.  Poured a hazed orange color.  The aroma is of spices and alcohol with some sweet malt.  Mild notes of bubble gum mixed in.  Mildly tart flavor with notes of banana and orange juice.  Odd!

21.5. St.Urhos Suomalaiset Sahdit Winner of Finnish Sahti. Cloudy Red orange brown, no head. Fresh but Super strong. lots of yeast, lighter body than the 8% version. like Old Ale.. Lots of sweet salmiak (strong liquorice)

Murky brown, practically no head. "Grilled banana with syrup and vanilla ice cream" on the nose. Spicy and intense. Flavor is sweet, syrupy banana with herb liqueur or cough drops. Strongly alcoholic finish. Medium bodied, flat palate. Sweet, but still easy drinking considering its strength.
Bottled. Hazy brown in colour. The aroma is sweet and alcohol like. The flavour is slightly better than the 8% little brother

75 cL bottle, thanks to Grovlam. Pours hazy orange to red. Little white head. Fruity, spiced and slight diacetyl aroma. Flavour is butterish at first but soon dwells into a solid spice and fruity flavour. Lingering finish of the same spices with a clear alcohol presence.

Bottle. [thank you, Grovlam]
Pours a deep redish brown with practically no head. Aroma has caramel, apples, Werthers Echte. Low carbonation - rather oily. Flavour is dry with plums, oranges and a light tartness. Where is that alcohol? This is quite nice, actually.

Bottle. Hazy golden red-brown colour. Sweet spiced (coriander) caramel juniper candy aroma. Thick sticky mouthfeel. Very sweet, spiced strangely sweet fruity, sweet bready flavour with some bitterness. Thanks Grovlam.

[Courtesy of Grovlam, session @ yespr]Red amber with no head. Aroma is candy sweet with plums and berries. Flavor is cloying sweet with notes of  plums, banana and berries. Alcohol is pretty well hidden

Bottle [Thanks to Harri for bring it back from Finland] Small fizzy white head that mostly diminished. Muddy amber colour. Spare lacework. This is very unique in the first time for me. Very fruit and somewhat spice with some alcohol. Some apple and plume and banana. Over the palate again very unique and strange with notes of grain, berries and Christmas like spice. Medium to almost full body with a flat carbonation and somewhat thick texture. Moderated to heavy sweet with light acidic. Spicy sweet and lingering finish.

Murky amber-honey colour with only the faintest of outgasing upon opening.  Large, firm sediment of yeast at the bottom of the bottle.  The aroma is full, repeat full, of bananas...like a hefeweizen on steroids.  Behind that, some smoke, butter and tangy berries.  Caramel also plays a big role, splashing in sugary sweet waves with the bananas.  The flavour is powerfully sweet, syrupy, with strong toffee and banana elements.  Smoke and butter are again present, along with the juniper berries.  Aside from the alcohol burn at the end theres not much to balance the massive sweetness here.  More tannic bitterness from the berries would be a good thing for me.  Sticky, full-ish body with no carbonation.  The aromas and flavours arent bad (unless you loathe diacetyl Im sure) but its really hard to finish this one, even slowly, due to the cloying nature.  75 cl bottle.

rbesg06, bottle i picked up in turku. hazy orange, plenty of vanilla and juniper in the aroma with a whiff of alcohol. some wheat sourness, actually made me imagine a dunkelweizenbock with a burnt banana aftertaste
Hazy amber of color - no head. An aroma with sweet notes, winegums and notes of wheat. A flavor with notes of sweet malt, notes of fruits, hints of yeast - tastes as a notfinish beer.
Bottle from Tbone_. Orange color, cloudy. Banana and lemon in the aroma. Thick and sweet. Banana, orange, lemon and onions in the flavor. Complex brew, full of flavor, but somewhat lacking in aroma.

Bottle from Alko brought home.
Strong taste of malt, of juniper, of stable and earth. No carbonation, but that might have fizzed out during transpoert, one of my shirts was rather drenched in the suitcase. A little yeasty finish, and my mouth feels like Ive had a cigar and a glass of gin.

Sampled at the RBSG 07 Grand Tasting.  A new country to the list!  Gold color with no head and a sweet aroma with some funk in there.  Apparently I really liked the flavor of this one, as I wrote down four more lines of comments on it.  Unfortunately I cant read a word of it...

RBSG 2007.  Thanks Jason.  The aroma is strong with juniper berries and twigs.  The beer pours to a murky orange caramel colored body with no head.  The flavor is tart.  Tons of juniper berries and slight gin.  Very strong concentrated flavors.  The palate is medium-light bodied with a gin-like palate.  Alcoholic.

RBSG 2007.  This looked more like a bottle of liquor, not beer.  Murky orange color with no head.  Bubble gum aroma.  Flavors of grapefruit, orange and a musty yeast finish.  I think Ive had a few Sahtis before and I dont remember them tasting like this at all.  Interesting.

Thanks for sharing heemer. Poured a cloudy orange color. Head was filmy and white. Very fruity aroma of pear, melon, and banana. Sweet and fruity on the tongue with apple, pear, and cherry. Finishes with a bit of acidity.

From a bottle recieved in a trade with oh6gdx. The body was fairly cloudy with a dark gold tint. There was a lot fo sediment at the bottom of the bottle. The taste was very sweet caramel with some pancakes and herbs. The taste was medicinal with some sweet apples. There was also that interesting note of juniper, especially in the finish. Interesting.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2009 Bottle.Hazy medium yellow amber color with virtually none head. Aroma is sweet banana, bubble gum, juniper berry, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic.  7-3-6-3-13 
Bottle 75cl.Unclear medium orange color with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, caramel, berry, juniper beery, moderate yeasty, babana, light alcohol. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long duration. Body is medium to full, texture is creamy - oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20090619]  8-3-8-3-15

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2015 Draught (St. Urhos, Helsinki, Sahti Days 2007)
Classic Sahti, almost defining the style. Medium dark murky brown or caramel colour, completely flat, as expected. Huge wafts of bananas and malty goodness on the nose, all delivered to the tongue. Slightly oily, sharp junipery bittern details on a sticky toffee-sweet malt canvas. Better than the  weak 8% version. They are in fact the same brew, they are simply tapped off the brewing vessel at different points.
Rerate: (8:4:8:4:16=4.0)
Wow - I love this beer! Happy birthday to me!

UPDATED: APR 28, 2007 [75 cl clear bottle] Cloudy amber colour. Just a hint of a head, very little carbonation. Smooth toffee & marshmallow aroma with faint noets of green bananas. Thick mouthfeel. Sweet toffee flavour with notes of Sauvignone Blanc grapes. Alcohol bitter finish. Nowhere near as complex as Lammin Sahti but still tasty.
How do they get this amount of diacety in to an ale, ther is nothing placent about it, did not finish my glas.

Courtesy of oh6gdx.  Pours brown and almost still.  Smells of bananas, cloves, lots of rustic sweetness, pine, juniper berries.  Tastes of spices, juniper, pine, some bananas, lots of misc flavors going on I cant put into words in a very good way.  Palate is thick and oily.  A definite sipper and a real gem of a beer!

[Bottle from Beermouth tasted with the hop-bros at Jess cosy inn.]

So close to its less stronger brother, that its only the 2 % and some alcohol taste in the flavor you can feel as a difference in these two enjoyable sweet beers from the cold north.
Almost like the ordenairy Sahti. Yellow/copper/reddish color with no head. Intens fruity taste with some caramel and hints of malt. to damn sweet for my taste.
Bottle at RBESG 2006. A really interesting experience. Despite being a sahti, tasted quite wheaty but with sourness thrown in. Quite enjoyable, barring the slightly unpleasant and overbearing finish.

Check my rating of the 8% version. Iäm comparing this one to it. This one has a more distinct aroma, much more clear and strict. It tastes less alchohol, (weird at 10%!) but has a smoother taste of honey, and is stronger. Unfortunately its not as oily. Its also darker.

Bottled - Bruxellensis - A hazy yellowy brown coloured beer with no head.  The aroma is like a weizen bock with alcohol, toffee and bruised banana.  The taste is more of the same but the alcohol really shows its colours.  Nice.

Drity orange color, very hazy beer. Small yellowisch foam. Strong lactic and fruity aroma. Hints of banana and cookies soaked in orange juse. Alcohol well present. Taste is rich and also lactic fruity. has some woody and yeasty aspects too. New style for me (very surprizing).

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2007 (Bottle BB 23/07/07) Aroma of banana and juniper berries. Brown red colour, very hazy (this time no sedimentation) and basically no head (some large bubbles). Sweet, banana, slightly alcoholic and juniper berry-like flavour. Oily, flat carbonated (typical for sahtis) and medium to full-bodied palate. Extremely good traditional Finnish sahti and one more reason for beer enthusiasts to visit Finland ;-) 13/06/07 (original rating was 6/3/7/4/14)

750 ml bottle, shared by DarkElf - thanks for the opportunity on this one!  Pours murky dark amber with a thin white head.  Aroma of slightly underripe banana, honey, notes of spring flowers and maple, with a faint hint of turpentine.  Sweet, yet unripe fruit in the flavor, again with the greenish banana, sour apple, tart and tannic as well,  definite alcohol presence in the first sips, then faded into the background as it sat.  Medum body with some sediment and particulate matter, gentle carbonation.  Very interesting and complex brew.

(750 ml bottle: Obtained in trade with bogdi1, thanks Juha!, and shared with SDbruboy) Ideally, I would have had a bottle of the regular Finlandia Sahti to do a side-by-side comparison, but alas, that couldnt be arranged.  But I do remember the near euphoria I experienced drinking the standard Sahti, and unfortunately, the Strong Sahti isnt quite measuring up.  The aroma is of green bananas and bubblegum, fairly sour but with a hint of sweetness.  But the flavor is very complex and quite a challenge for me to discern all that is going on here considering my limited exposure to these unusual flavors.  Green bananas again, lots of spice and bubblegum, quite fruity, moderately tart and citric, light sweetness in the background.  Theres a noticeable bitterness in the finish which I could do without, and though the alcohol is hidden for the most part, it is perceptible and a slight distraction for me with this style.  I dont want to taste alcohol, I want to just immerse myself in the glorious beverage that is Sahti.  The palate is light-medium in body, lightly carbonated, tart and acidic, and quite refreshing.  Plenty of sediment in the bottle, so the beer pours a dark, murky amber.  The small head is mostly just a sheen, but leaves spots of lace all over the glass.  Still quite an enjoyable treat, but I definitely like Finlandias standard Sahti better.

Bottle - sampled at the RBESP 2005
Murky orange brown. Wheaty aroma with minerally overtones. Marzipan, vanilla added in the flavor. Medium body. Herbal aftertaste.

Bottle, at RBESG grand tasting, August 2005. I have to say that, apart from being maybe a shade darker in colour, I found this, to all extents and purposes, indistinguishable from the normal version. Flowery, perfumed and too sickly for me.

[bottle at LCRBM] pours an almost luminous hazy orange with little head. Aroma had apricot, gooseberrys, also had some ginish notes, that will be the juniper, also some gooseberry and yeast. one of the strangest beers i have tried.

At the LCRBM. Thanks Jeppe, boy what an experience - pulled me from my socks ;-) Hazy orange color, no head. Sweet cough medicine nose and taste with lots of alcohol. The taste was like overriped, rotten apricot. Quite interesting but - pfui - I did not like this!

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2007 No#38. I was told this is filtered only by passing it over juniper leaves, nice. Aroma has got a strong apricot, cheesey feet smell, good. Taste is similar and very full, with a sourness making it even fuller. Intresting style to try out.  RERATE: Amazing ale in every way.

At the LCRBM (Kulminator Antwerp). Very very hazy dirty soft orange coloured beer with small yellowish head. Smell of this very original beer is a little strange. It is lactic, it reminds to fresh youghurt flowers, it also has this fresh cheesy yeastyness and has hints of slight oxidized mash (purée) of stone fruit like apricots, peaches, bergamots and mirabels. All these items together have the smell of a baby who just puked up his fruit porridge (please dont get me wrong) this is not negative at all. The taste is super refreshing and perfect in balance (sweet and sour). It has this fine slight sweet malty caracter, it also has touches of cheesecake (kwarktaart) and the fruity aspect is just so vived and crisp. This beer has touches of mango chutny, renette apples, mild spices and the interior of a barn in the Alps. Great stuff, I guess im a Sahti fan ! Thanks Jeppe for bringing this very original brew.

Bottle at LCRBM. this surely is a love or hate beer! hazy orange, almost no head. aroma: (juniper)berries, spicy, bubblegum. taste: sour, acidic(probably lactic) but also very citric. very long and sour finish. strange.....

LCRBM. Looking forward on all the other ratings here! Hazy maize-coloured beer. Virtually no head. Nose reminded me of old maize, kept in a shed for a very long time to feed the cattle with. Not exactly what Im looking for in a beer. Very chemical sour taste, vinegar and puke. Actually pretty wellbodied, so this disgusting taste even lingers longer than Id want. This screams nearly undrinkable to me, but watching other peoples reviews Id say: This is not my cup of tea. Ill pass this on to Tim...

Bottled at LC-RBM. Aroma of bread and all kinds of sweet fruits like peach, apricot and pear. Cloudy, orange color, beige head, good lace. Acidic, peach and strong lemon flavor. Sticky yet dry in the finish. This was my first Sahti and if the next one like this then that one is going to be the last.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2007 Disclaimer: below are two ratings for this beer.  The points are for the rerate, since that wasnt just a sip on a large tasting session.

Rerate - Bottle, thanks to Pat (oh6gdx) for trading!  Hazy, muddy amber body.  Off-white frothy head.  Aroma of flowers, hops, liquor, grass.  Nice balance in the aroma.  Moderately sweet, lightly bitter flavour.  Quite sweet finish.  Ok, but not great.  I remembered this more sour. 8/4/8/4/14 = 3.8

Bottle at RBG Low Countries 2005 Tasting Session Murky, orange body.  White head.  Nose of dough, barnyard, leather, earth, boxes for kitchen garbage (GFT-boxes)  Lightly sweet, heavily acidic initial flavour.  Lightly sweet, moderately acidic finish.  Very lively.  Very nice one, reminds me of gueuze. 8/4/9/4/17 = 4.2

Brought by Jeppe, who warned us about a slightly passed BBD  Colour like mixed orange & tomato juice, with a little orange head. Banana esters and phenolic nose, with a little Brett-like finish. Sourish taste, as Bavarian Weisse mixed with fresh lemon, orange & banana juice. Retronasal I DO get juniper, as the branches smell. Extremely refreshing, and rather well-bodied. Alcoholwarming. WOW! Thanks, Jeppe, a discovery!
RBESG 2005, hazy orange beer with almost no head. Wheatbeer like sweet fruity aroma. Malty and sweet, light fruity flavor with some alcohol in the finish.

Bottled. Hazy brown colour, no head. Vanilla, bananas and alcohol in aroma. Wheat, bananas, vanilla in flavour, with a peak of alcohol in finish. Sticky palate afterwards. Quite pleasant, but the alcoholic kick in the end is not very nice..

Bottle. Yipes, loads of estery rotting bananas in this one. Quite smooth and very sweet, with a fair amount of alcohol showing through at the end. Ill give this one points for being quite interesting, but this isnt something i could sit down and really enjoy. Bloody hell, bananas!
RBESG05: Spice, vanilla and bubblegum in nose. Gold hazy flat. Sweet flavour. Smooth light bodied, quite tasty.
Bottle. Dark muddy amber colour with no head. Wheaty sugar fruity aroma and a sweet light smoked, fruity taste. Light body and a sweet finish.

(Bottle 75 cl) Hazy, dark amber golden. Very small head and a rather low carbonation. Distinct scent of wheat like in a Dunkles Hefeweizen - but perhaps its not wheat at all but rye?? Wheaty, fruity notes of plums and the likes and some very sweet honey notes. Quite lovely and very original but gets cloying eventually. 120805
An unclear dark orange beer with no head to speak of. The aroma is very wheaty and the flavor is sweet and containing some weird spices, that I cant pick out. This is not a beer for me.

Bottle at RBESG Grand Tasting 05. Smells wheaty like a hefe. Thin in the mouth, but silky too. Nice orange/brown colour. Some fruit, polish, gluey jam, and berry flavour to finish. Very sweet aftertaste. OK, but a little bit over sweet for me.
(bottle at RBESG 2005) Hazy dark orange. Nose of pine and loads of sugar. Cloying sweet taste of malts and rawsugar; almost no finish. No trace of the 10%.
Bottle @ RBESG2005. Alcoholic nose, notes of sweet fruits. Hazy dark amber body, small white head. Dry and fruity flavor, with some yeasty notes. Funny and interesting beer, i like it!

2005 bottle from Juha, thanks my man!!  Nose is sticky toffee, saltwater taffee, bit of fusel alcohol, juniper spicing.  Vibrant reddish orange, beautifully hazy and unfiltered.   Large off-white head recedes rapidly to a ring then bubbles.  Flavor is caramel sweet at first, and then light sourness which is particularly enjoyable.  Cinnamon and juniper in there and then a finish of raw alcohol, though its not dominated by it.  Very low carbonation is lightly tingly.  Medium-full body.  Apple cider notes retronasal.  Sticky and substantial, loved it!

Keg @ Helsinki Beer Festival, Helsinki Finland Backlog 2 April, 2005Appearant alcohol content. Almost belgian in style. A warming winter sahti, this one. Less complex than their weaker (8%) version. Some butterscotch notes detected in the end.

Bottled (BB 16.07.04)
Hazy nut brown, no head. Banana and juniper aroma. Smooth, sweet with juniper bitter. Hides alcohol completely.

Copper, cloudy color. Aroma even more fruity than in lighter version. Flavor is combination of banana and some lemon, lemon flavor stays longer. I waited more of carbonation, could have done this Sahti better. There is only week to use-by date, I dont know if some carbonates may have lost... Leaves nice warm citrus feeling to mouth. Too sweet and fruity for me, surprised me that this beer didnt have much of a alcohol taste.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2008 (Bottled, 0.75l, BBE 12 Apr, 2004) Muddy, dark amber/red color (darker than the 8% Finlandia), no head. Extremely fruity, sweet banana/strawberry aroma. Sweet and sour, banana-fruity flavor. Smooth, oily, medium to full-bodied palate. The alcohol doesnt taste at all - a very dangerous, but pleasant drink! Update: clearly better than the 8% version. Very nice when fresh!

Rating the Finlandia Strong next to the regular Finlandia, one thing comes to mind: I can't believe these 750ml bottles use screwtops!  What's up with that?!  As for the taste, neither is sweet like the delicious Lammin Sahti, but the tartness of regular Finlandia is muted in Finlandia Strong and replaced by even more fruit (apples, juniper berries, citrus).  It's like a Belgian fruit lambic.  The whopping 10% abv is extremely well-hidden!  Bravo!  Oh yeah, virtually no carbo and murky brown like unfiltered apple cider.

Orange-brown colour, fine head, apple and grapefruit aroma with notes of juniper, very sweet balanced by alcohol and acidity, aftertaste of alcohol, apple and other fruits, a little bit sweeties-like - very original with lot of character
Colour of applejuice with few foam. Aroma of apple, nice balance between sweetness and acidity. Long lasting aftertaste of acidity and apple. An interesting and original beer.

Sampled draught at Helsinki Beer Festival.
Dark amber and very cloudy. Big estery banana aroma. Firm and sweet, slightly vinous, nicely rounded. Some rye character.
Sinus-clearing strength.  Smoother than the regular Finlandia Sahti, but less complex.  Strong finishing kick.
